SUMMARY:  INNER | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL:  FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.heaton.bot
Class HTTP

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.heaton.bot.HTTP
Direct Known Subclasses:
HTTPSocket
public abstract class HTTP
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements an HTTP handler. The low-level details are left to a derived class. Most likely you will be using the HTTPSocket class, which derives from this one. This class handles these specific issues: + Cookies + The referrer tag + HTTP User Authentication + Automatic Redirection + Parsing headers Copyright 2001 by Jeff Heaton

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jeff Heaton

HTTP

public HTTP()
Method Detail

copy

abstract HTTP copy()
The copy method is used to create a new copy of this HTTP handler. This method is implemented abstract and should be implemented by derived classes.
Returns:
A new HTTP handler.

lowLevelSend

protected abstract void lowLevelSend(java.lang.String url,
                                     java.lang.String post)
                              throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                                     java.io.IOException
This method actually sends the data. This is where derived classes implement their own low-level send.
Parameters:
url - The URL to send data to.
post - Any data that is to be posted. If no data is posted, this method does an HTTP GET.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException - Thrown if the host can not be located.
java.io.IOException - Thrown if a network error occurs.

clearCookies

public void clearCookies()
This method is called to clear any cookies that this HTTP object might be holding.

protected void addCookieHeader()
This method is called to add any applicable cookies to the header.

protected void addAuthHeader()
This method is called to add the user authorization headers to the HTTP request.

send

public void send(java.lang.String url,
                 java.lang.String post)
          throws java.net.UnknownHostException,
                 java.io.IOException
Send is the public interface to this class that actually sends an HTTP request.
Parameters:
url - The URL being sent to.
post - Any data to post.
Throws:
java.net.UnknownHostException -  
java.io.IOException -  

getBody

public java.lang.String getBody()
This method is called to get the body data that was returned by this request.
Returns:
The body data for the last request.

getURL

public java.lang.String getURL()
Get the URL that was ultimately requested. You might get a different URL than was requested if auto redirection is enabled.

setURL

public void setURL(java.lang.String u)
Called to set the internal URL that is kept for the last request.
Parameters:
u - The new URL.

SetAutoRedirect

public void SetAutoRedirect(boolean b)
Used to determine if the HTTP class should automatically resolve any HTTP redirects.
Parameters:
b - True to resolve redirects, false otherwise.

This method will return an AttributeLIst of client headers.

An AttributeList of client headers.

This method is called internally to parse any cookies and add them to the cookie store.

getCookie

public CookieParse getCookie(java.lang.String name)
This method is used to access a specific cookie.
Parameters:
name - The name of the cookie being sought.
Returns:
The cookie being sought, or null.

setUseCookies

public void setUseCookies(boolean session,
                          boolean perm)
This method controls the use of cookies by this HTTP object.
Parameters:
session - True to use session cookies, false not to.
perm - True to use permanent cookies, false not to.

getUseCookies

public boolean getUseCookies()
This method allows you to determine if session cookies are being used.
Returns:
True if session cookies are being used.

getPerminantCookies

public boolean getPerminantCookies()
This method allows you to determine if permanent cookies are being used.
Returns:
Returns true if permanent cookies are being used, false otherwise.

This method is called to set the amount of time that the HTTP class will wait for the requested resource.
Parameters:
i - The timeout in milliseconds.

public int getTimeout()
This method will return the amount of time in milliseconds that the HTTP object will wait for a timeout.

This method will set the maximum body size that will be downloaded.
Parameters:
i - The maximum body size, or -1 for unlimted.

This method will return the maximum body size that will be downloaded.

getAgent

public java.lang.String getAgent()
Returns the user agent being reported by this HTTP class. The user agent allows the web server to determine what software the web-browser is using.
Returns:
The agent string being presented to web servers.

public void setAgent(java.lang.String a)
This method is called to set the agent reported to the browser.
Parameters:
a - The user agent string to be reported to servers.
